page.title: 03EDUCATION
page.content: {A YEAR AT COATES SCHOOL 1984-1985.} COATES NATIONAL SCHOOL WAS FOUNDED IN 1849.A SCHOOL AND A HOUSE, FOR THE HEADTEACHER, BEING BUILT BY THE EARL OF BATHURST.THE HOUSE WAS USED BY THE HEADTEACHERS UNTIL 1976.THERE ARE 21 CHILDREN AT THE SCHOOL WHO ALL LIVE IN COATES.THE THREE TEACHERS COME FROM CHELTENHAM AND CIRENCESTER. THE TEACHERS ARRIVE BY 8.45 A.M.AND WE PLAY IN THE PLAYGROUND UNTIL 9 A.M. WE THEN GO INTO SCHOOL FOR ASSEMBLY. DURING THE MORNING WE DO MATHEMATICS AND ENGLISH, WATCH SOME TELEVISION PROGRAMMES AND USE THE COMPUTER.WE HAVE A BREAK AT 10.45 AND START LESSONS AGAIN AT 11 O'CLOCK. WE HAVE DINNER AT MIDDAY.SOME CHILDREN GO HOME,SOME HAVE SCHOOL DINNERS BUT MOST OF US HAVE SANDWICHES.THEN WE PLAY WITH ROPES AND BALLS IN THE PLAYGROUND.
